column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Use Autostick
#Text=So you bought a car with an auto-stick ( manually-controllable automatic transmission ) function , and you 're wondering how to use it .
#Text=Well , pay attention .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Get into your car and adjust mirrors and seats .
#Text=Start the car and find a nice long empty stretch of road for trying this out .
#Text=Put the car into first gear ( or the sport/auto-stick gear ) .

#Text=Step on the gas and reach desired RPM ( ~3500 or so for general use ; higher , toward but not past the red line for high performance in appropriate conditions , not when learning ) before shifting .
#Text=Shift up either hitting the shifter to the right , or hitting it up ( depends on the vehicle ) .
#Text=Shift down when you are decelerating and get to low RPM , ~1500 or so , by tapping the shifter in the other direction .
#Text=( An auto stick transmission normally does not need to be put in neutral , just first , when stopped . )

#Text=Many cars will shift on their own rather than go to a too-high RPM and break something or go to a too-low RPM and stall , but unless you have confirmed that yours will , watch ( and when you 're accustomed , listen for ) the RPM and shift accordingly .
#Text=When you are comfortable with the system , you could race with it in an appropriate time and place .
#Text=One user has suggested as a racing technique " Stand on the brake and floor the accelerator until you reach ~ 5000 RPM .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=which might be similar to  dropping the clutch " in a manual car .

column1: #Text=Such techniques are very hard on the car .
#Text=An auto shift transmission is nice for driving in mountains because it is so easy to downshift for engine braking .
#Text=Tips
#Text=since transmission shifts are more noticeable you can usually just listen to the car and when it reaches the peak RPM you 'll be able to hear , that 's the best time to shift .
#Text=No two cars drive the same , each car has it 's own optimal RPM
#Text=get a feel for it before you start stomping the gas .
#Text=most of the time you 're going to want to shift at 3000 RPM to avoid stress on the cars transmission
#Text=for an ideal shift you 're going to want 4000 RPM or even higher if you 're racing
#Text=Do n't be afraid to ask somebody about how to use this feature on your car .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Failure to shift on time could cause major damage to your cars transmission so be careful
#Text=always keep in mind that sometimes you will exceed the speed limit posted on the road so keep in mind that there may be police/children , pets , or weather conditions
#Text=always be careful when operating a motor vehicle
#Text=your car will be traveling at high speeds so take all precautions when using this function
